description: Part demolition of the rear of Eagle House and the retention and refurbishment of the remainder of the building together with the erection of a part 6, part 7, part 27 storey building plus basement level to provide 278 residential units comprising 37 x studios, 70 x 1 bedroom, 78 x 2 bedroom, 65 x 3 bedroom, 25 x 4 bedroom and 3 x more than 4 bedroom units and 1271 sq. of Class A1 (retail) floor space, 447 sq. of Class A3 (restaurant) floor space, 3486 sq. of Class B1 (office) floor space and 1108 sq. m of Class D2 (Leisure) floor space together with ancillary plant, servicing, 56 basement level car parking spaces.  Associated hard and soft landscaping, alterations to existing vehicular and pedestrian access and associated highway works.
decision_conditions: This Council considers the scale, height and form of the proposed building to be harmful to the setting of the adjacent listed buildings and the wider townscape and Moorfields Conservation Area. There is also discrepancy between the form and function of the building with single level flats reading as maisonettes from the seventh storey upwards. Further more the level of basement parking is also considered to be excessive and contrary to policies restricting off street parking facilities in inner London. It is also noted that most of the units are single aspect, with many orientated to the north, although the number of staircases and lifts would allow for a substantial number of dual aspect flats.
